question: Which island houses "Piton de la Fournaise" volcano?
explanation: Piton de la Fournaise is a 2632 meters high active stratovolcano located in the Reunion Island, an overseas region of France located in the Indian Ocean. It is currently one of the most active volcanoes in the world. This volcano is located within the Reunion National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is also a major tourist attraction on Reunion Island.
